title: Little Tip
body:
Listening to a certain genre of music before playing can drastically change the way you play/react with your team.

Doubt anyone will care but if this helps one person out I'll be glad.

replies.body:
I actually have a different set of songs for each champion, each set get's me into the proper mindset/mood for each specific champ and it's all good music obviously 

I listen to it while I play though

> [{quoted}](name=Slythion,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oo5iEzjd,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-07-27T01:29:29.121+0000)
>
> I actually have a different set of songs for each champion, each set get's me into the proper mindset/mood for each specific champ and it's all good music obviously 
> 
> I listen to it while I play though

That's awesome! Mind sharing your playlists?

I don't play while listening to music because I focus the game sounds in order to know what abilities my opponent is using.
Especially important to listen to the in-game sounds when against Sion and Kled (once he's in).

Jhin = Dance of the Knights - Prokofiev

The tempo and base match his autos almost perfectly.
Doesn't Jhin's attack speed change throughout the game?
I don't really listen to anything specific for each champion, but like i will say that fear's album "the record" seems pretty fitting for a lot of the noxus champions.

Twitch - Grace & Glory
Volibear - End of all (Land/Sky/Below/Shigure)

Jinx - Technopathetic
